description.narrative:
Religious extremism cases have increased rapidly for the past two years, eroded diversity and pluralism values which is part of Indonesia#s fundamental ideology and specifically affected religious minorities, LGBT community, and unmarried sexually active people.In Fact, not only adults, but religious extremism has affected youth#s lives and shaped their ideology. Recent credible survey on the perception of young Muslim by INVID stated that 22.2% agreed that violence is a right way to treat #kafir# (a derogatory term for non-muslims). In February 2018, hundreds of religious school students in West Lombok took the street to resist LGBT community. Collaborative research of Monash University, Islamic Walisongo Unversity of Semarang, and the Gadjah Mada University of Yogyakarta, in February 2018. found there are many schools in East Java that is potential to develop religious extremism. As a youth-led organization, ARI believes in diversity, gender equality, and universal human rights that have been our concern. We believe it is crucial to equipped youth, especially young activists such as ARI#s members or other youth organization, with adequate knowledge and capacity onreligious extremism and strategy to tackle it and gain bigger force and impact. To address that ARI general objective for this program is to improve the capacity of youth (age 15 -24) in two cities in Indonesia so they can be the agents of change to suppress religious extremism. Therefore ARI specific objectives are:
1. Strengthening the capacity of selected ARI members on the understanding of religious extremism and how to tackle it 2. Developing a support mechanism and tools to enable young activists to empower other youth in suppressing religious extremism 3. Raise awareness and build a network to gain support from other youth and prominent religious figures/leaders
To achieve these objectives, ARI will implement activities which target youth in West Lombok and Pati, where there are many religious schools and cases of youth engage in religious extremism were found. Those two areas are also home of ARI local chapters and have been intervened by ARI before for another issues such as meaningful youth participation (MYP). Those two areas also have similarities such as religious leaders hold a very strong position in the community and are based of many religious schools.
First, ARI will conduct training of trainers that will capacitate ARI members. ARI members become the targetof this training because they have been capacitated in other key interests such as meaningful-youth participation, advocacy, genderequality, etc, that will benefit the next activity that is developing module and booklet on extremism. We want this module#s materials to be comprehensive,gender sensitized and feasible for youth to implement. After the module is finished, we will conduct the E-learning Sessions that will be participated by young activists from ARI and other youth organizations or community with various background, especially those are the most vulnerable like an interfaith forum or transgender community. Next, we will continue with networking dialogue between capacitated young activists to discuss the next activity (roadshow of raising awareness campaign in religious schools) and another opportunity to work together. Lastly, we will share this report in level to the Ministry of Religious Affairsand other prominent religious groups such as Nahdlatul Ulama to explain our best practices and module in hopes they will adopt or replicate it.

participating-org.narrative:
Aliansi Remaja Independen (ARI or Independent Young People Alliance) is a youth-led organization by and for young people aged 10-24 years old. ARI is registered under the Ministry of Law and Human Rights as a non-government organization (NGO) in 2012. Until now ARI is the only independent youth-led organization in Indonesia without any affiliation with other organizations including politicalor religious parties. Until now, besides ARI in Jakarta that is working for national issues, ARI has developed and had 5 branches in 5 provinces namely, West Java, East Java, West Nusa Tenggara, East Nusa Tenggara and South Sulawesi.
To manage its daily activities, ARI has Executive Board members at national and provincial levels which in total are around 35 Executive Board members. Besidesthat, ARI also has around 120 registered members whose role is to ensure ARI's mission is implemented through volunteerism. As an organization by and for young people, ARI has an extensive network of young people not only inprovinces where ARI's branches locatedbut also throughout Indonesia. Currently, data shows that ARI has more than 10,000 young volunteers all over Indonesia who are ready to contribute. As a youth-led organization, ARI strongly holds its idealism of meaningful youth participation, youth-adult partnership, gender equality, diversity, inclusivity, human rights and child rights.
ARI#s vision is #Empowered young people, able to be equal, independent, responsible, their rights are fulfilled and able to participate actively in Indonesia's program development.#
While ARI#s mission is: To assist the government in ensuring that every Indonesian young people can reach their optimum health status, able to finish the compulsory formal education and have access to employment based on their capacity and interest. Based on its mission, ARI has three focus areas of work which are Health, Education, and Employment. To fulfill its mission, ARI has three core programs consisting of, 1. Educate, empower and facilitate network by and for young people 2. Provide inputs and conduct advocacy activities to ensure government programs and policies are for the best benefits of young people. 3. Educate and mobilize the community toensure the realization of good qualityyoung people.
Through the years ARI has implemented activities that advance the cause for young people community. There are some notable achievements during the process. Among others, ARI was the only youth-led organization participated in the judicial review of marriage law in 2014. ARI was one of the youth-led organization that represented Indonesia inHigh Level Political Forum (HPLF) in 2017 to review achievement of national voluntary review. ARI has also mobilized thousands of young people to celebrate young people#s diversity and promote SRHR in a biennial event called #Youth Health Celebration#. Being a youth-led organization where many of its Executive Board members and members are high school and college students. Thus, to make the working hours more youth friendly, ARI does not impose regular working time. Regardless the flexible time, ARI members always give full commitment and deliver the great result.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
